bow: dadditor here trying to keep costs down with prescriptions for anti nausea meds my lovely lovely wife and are expecting baby come early july she getting the typical morning sickness and her ob gyn suggested the medication diglesic apparently it was off the market for while and is now only sold in branded form with no generic alternatives this medication works very very well we were given script for it but the pharmacy did fill it until we personally ok it why it expensive we re fortunate to have our own insurance but even then it nearly 80 for 30 days worth have any of you wonderful mommies had good experience with alternatives ll likely go and bit the bullet for the diglesic but if there something out there equally effective that wo run us broke all ears your can always ask the doctor to write script for generic brand the pharmacist should be able to tell you what other meds might help what safe etc she has her next appointment on the 9th woo first sonogram so ll make sure to ask if can find the time ll also speak to the local pharmacist thanks no problem it crazy how expensive everything is hope all goes well and congrats there no generic but diclegis is an easy diy it basically just unisom which is about ten bucks pack combined with vitamin b6 my doctor recommended start with 25mg of b6 and unisom before bed then another b6 in the morning adding second unisom then if necessary google it and ask your doctor obviously this is my third pregnancy as well and it has been way easier and much more comfortable taking this than zofran which is crazy strong our insurance has repeatedly denied the rx for zofran generic that my wife needs to the tune of 500 month she very sensitive to medications in the class of unisom but we ll try so far she been doing much better but like to make this as easy as possible especially with kiddos already keeping her busy yay for the american healthcare system she coping as well as she can and it my goal to make her happy and comfortable brutal jpg glad that our insurance will eat most of the cost for diglesic but it still quite expensive do you have cyclizine in the states it safe for pregnancy and prescribed by nhs in
